Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. LINKAGES, a central mechanism, ensures that partner governments and civil society have the technical capacity to provide coverage of comprehensive HIV/AIDS services for key populations (KPs) and their sexual partners at scale. The global program goal is to strengthen capacity of governments and civil society to implement high quality, sustainable, evidence-based and comprehensive HIV/AIDS prevention, care and treatment services with KPs at scale. The program targets key populations defined as sex workers (SW), men who have sex with men (MSM), transgender persons (TG), people who inject drugs (PWID), and their sexual partners. Because their sexual and drug use behaviors are illegal and/or stigmatized in most societies, these populations are marginalized and experience discrimination. Reaching them with HIV services requires tailored approaches.
LINKAGES supports PEPFAR/India’s Strategy Goal #1: Improved access to quality services, and the PEPFAR Blueprint’s Roadmap for Smart Investments: Increase access to and uptake of HIV services by key populations. Evidence-based, high quality HIV/AIDS prevention, care and treatment programs, targeted at populations at greatest risk, are expected to contribute to reduced morbidity and mortality and improved quality of life.
LINKAGES supports increased availability of quality services at scale, including referrals and linkages across the community-clinic service continuum. To ensure sustainability, LINKAGES proposes an integrated behavior change, community mobilization and structural interventions approach that increases availability of and demand for comprehensive services across the continuum of care for KPs, and strengthens systems for planning, monitoring, evaluating and assuring the quality of programs for KPs.
